item.description:
Boston Investors Business Daily Rejuvenation Meeting
Converting Ideas into Investing


On March 19, at 7:00 PM, we’ll meet at Boston College to brainstorm how to make Boston IBD meetings more interesting, informative, and fun. Thanks to Arnie Corazzini we have a beautiful room in which to talk about different ways of using our association to discuss the economy, markets, and investing. Join us to help improve Boston IBD meetings.

Map or link to map and directions - Higgins Hall in red

What is Boston IBD?

Boston IBD has grown to about 900 members. Our monthly schedule has evolved to include several types of meetings:
  • Our regular meetings – the main meeting, the Tuesday trader’s meeting and our Guest Speaker meeting.
  • Platform meetings, such as Fidelity.
  • System meetings, such as the IBD Method meeting and our Value Investing meeting.

We also have lively online dialog via our Google Groups. How can we incorporate our online forums into future group services?

Boston IBD provides a forum to exchange ideas on investing. Boston IBD members have a wealth of expertise that you can tap into. We need your input at the Rejuvenation meeting to plan for the future.

What Will Happen At the Rejuvenation Meeting?

Most important, we’d like to hear your ideas on what you would like to have happen in Boston IBD. What would make Boston IBD more useful to you? How can we make that happen?

Please bring:
  • Topics you’d like to hear
  • Other events we can create
  • Ways you can help make Boston IBD better

Most of our speakers are members! They are people like you - people who share their thoughts and ideas with you. Think about what you’d like to bring to the group.

RSVP Now

We urge you to RSVP now using this link. We look forward to sharing your ideas at the Rejuvenation meeting.

Parking at Boston College

Here is a campus map. Click it and print it out.

Plan #1 There are two parking garages. Arnie recommends the Commonwealth Ave. garage. Park up on the fifth floor where there is a small foot bridge connecting the garage to the back side of O’Neal library. Walk past that building and the next one on the left will be Higgins. You will enter on level 1.

Plan#2 You can park in the Beacon Street garage. A couple of minutes more in walking. Not as direct and you can enter either the back entrance level 1, or front level 3.

Plan#3 You can park on Beacon Street. There are signs on the street for allowable hours. After parking, enter through the gate (check map since there are 3 on Beacon St.) and walk up to the front of Higgins level 3. You also might be able to park on Commonwealth Ave. but it will be a longer walk and parking might be more scarce.
item.name: Boston IBD Rejuvenation Meeting
